data.title: Show in a Week: The Aristocats Kids cast members

data.text:
Rehearsed and performed in one week:

Monday 29 – Friday 2 August 2024

CAST SPACES SOLD OUT

Please email us if you would like to join the waiting list.

Open to anyone aged 7-11 as of 31 August 2024

For beginners, experienced performers and everyone in between

You don’t need to have done anything with Trinity Youth Theatre before to take part

Everyone who signs up gets cast in the show, with low-pressure auditions determining who takes on what role.

All cast members get a show t-shirt and digital copies of the show photos.

We provide the costumes, make-up, props and set, making the show look at brilliant as possible. Our young cast rehearse, perform, have fun, make friends and create memories that will last for years!

There will be one cast for the show, and rehearsals will take place at Trinity Theatre.

Casts rehearse from 1pm – 5pm each day and it costs £180 for the week (working out at £36 per half day).

There will be one performance, currently scheduled for 4pm on Friday 2 August.

You can pay in whole upfront or in instalments which are due by the following dates (Instalment 1 is needed to confirm your space, which are allocated first-come, first-served):

Instalment 2: 17 April

Instalment 3: 17 May

We know times are currently financial tough for some families, and don’t want anybody who wants to come to be put off by the price. We have bursaries available via The Elliott Fund for those who need financial support.

Our shows often have waiting lists, and so refunds are only possible if we are able to find someone else to take your space once we have sold out.

What’s the Schedule?

Rehearsals: Monday 29 July – Friday 2 August

Performance: Friday 2 August

What’s The Aristocats About?

Based on the beloved Disney animated film, and featuring a jazzy, upbeat score, Disney’s The Aristocats Kids is a non-stop thrill ride of feline fun, complete with unbelievable twists and turns.

In the heart of Paris, a kind and eccentric millionairess wills her entire estate to Duchess, her high-society cat, and her three little kittens. Laughs and adventure ensue as the greedy, bumbling butler pulls off the ultimate catnap caper. Now it’s up to the rough-and-tumble alley cat, Thomas O’Malley, and his band of swingin’ jazz cats to save the day.

“I just wanted to say a HUGE thank you to everyone involved with the production of Winnie the Pooh last week. My daughter had an absolutely fabulous time and enjoyed every minute. The performance was wonderful! The programmes, photography, costumes, sound and stage management were so professional. The whole production was such a great experience for the children and so enjoyable to watch.“

A cast member’s parent from our 2021 show

All staff are DBS checked and led by experienced youth theatre practitioners. Please see Trinity Theatre’s Safeguarding Policy for more information.

If you have any questions about our Show in a Week or Trinity Youth Theatre, please email Jason and Rachel in our Creative Engagement team and they will get back to you as soon as they can.

Performed by
